questions.question_text: The probability Lisa hits a bullseye in a game of darts at the end of a workday is 0.02. The probability she hits a bullseye on a non workday is 0.3. Lisa is a school teacher and works everyday from Monday to Friday but not on the weekends. Each throw is independent of each other. a. What is the probability Lisa hits three bullseyes in a row on a Wednesday night? b. What is the probability she hits exactly t hree bullse yes out of four throws on a Saturday? c. Lisa has five throws on a Friday night. Given that she throws three bullseyes on her first three throws , what is the probability she throws exactly four bullseyes? Let tn represent the number of throws on a particular Thursday evening and sn represent the number of throws on a Saturday evening. d. If the mean number of bullseyes Lisa scored on the Thursday evening was the same as the mean number she scored on a Saturday evening, find tn in terms of sn, giving a general solution. Assume she had at least one throw on each evening. The time Lisa spends practi sing her dart throwing each day is a random variable, T hours, with probability density function, d given by ( )21 12 () 3 2 3 0 elsewherett dt at b t− ≤≤= − + <≤  where a and b are real constants. e. Find a and b if the graph of d is continuous for 3t−∞< ≤ .
